content.title: Mukhyamantri Tirth Yatra Yojana
content.department: Directorate of Information, Public Relations & Languages, Government of Haryana
content.details: The scheme 'Mukhyamantri Tirth Yatra Yojana' is implemented by the Directorate of Information, Public Relations & Languages, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, members of families with an annual income of less than ₹1.80 lakhs who are over 60 years of age will be taken for pilgrimages to Ayodhya, Varanasi, and other sacred places. The state government will bear all the expenses for their travel.
benefits: Facility for senior citizens to visit religious destinations such as Ayodhya, Varanasi, Nanded Sahib, Patna Sahib, Ajmer Sharif, and other such destinations in India.
Ensures that constraints of travel and local arrangements do not hinder senior citizens from undertaking the journey.
Government bears the cost of Rail travel (to and fro) in 3rd tier AC to destinations such as Ayodhya, Varanasi, Nanded Sahib, Patna Sahib, Ajmer Sharif, and other such destinations in India.
Cost of transport from the place of residence to the Start of Train journey station is reimbursed after journey completion.
Facility of an attendant for applicants over 80 years of age on payment of 50% of railway ticket fare.
eligibility: The applicant should be a bonafide resident of Haryana.
The applicant should possess a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP ID).
The applicant should have completed 60 years of age (as on 1st January of the year in which the application is made).
The applicant can avail the benefit of the scheme once every three years.
Family Income of the applicant from all known sources should be upto ₹1,80,000/- per annum as verified by PPP.
The attendant should be a bonafide resident of Haryana with Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP ID).
content.application_process: Online - via CSCs. Eligible applicants may apply online through the Official Portal- Antyodaya SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: Which destinations are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers pilgrimages to Ayodhya, Varanasi, Nanded Sahib, Patna Sahib, Ajmer Sharif, and other sacred places in India.

faqs.question: What expenses does the government bear under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The government covers the cost of rail travel in 3rd tier AC, local transportation from residence to the train station, and back.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide residents of Haryana, aged 60 and above, with an annual family income up to ₹1.80 lakhs, and possessing a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP ID).

faqs.question: Is there an age relaxation for the accompanying spouse?
faqs.answer: Yes, age relaxation is provided for the spouse accompanying the main applicant.

faqs.question: Can the applicant take an attendant along?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants aged above 80 can take an attendant along by paying 50% of the railway ticket fare.

faqs.question: How often can an applicant avail the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: An applicant can avail the benefits once every three years.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply online through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: Is there a reimbursement process for local transportation costs?
faqs.answer: Yes, local transportation costs to the train station are reimbursed after journey completion, in the applicant's bank account linked with PPP ID.

faqs.question: How is family income verified for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Family income is verified through the Parivar Pehchan Patra.
